intro: Hieracium hervieri, commonly known as the Hervier's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium hervieri is often found in temperate climates and can be invasive in certain regions.
